title: Emails won't send keeps asking to verify email address
content: This shows when trying to send an email; Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Sender Policy - Relay Denied 159.196.13.34 authenticated connections ONLY. OB303 e{ea37e87f-1ae2-401c-8977-65fa15359de5}. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again. Works ok in the default Telstra Webmail page.
creator: ruth8400

title: Can't Use Gmail In Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I just recently remember Thunderbird can be used as an email client. So, I've decided to use Thunderbird again after years of stop using it. I download the installer, install it, run it, and try to login to my Google account. But, I get an error (refer the image attached). I'm sure I already enable IMAP in my Gmail settings, and very sure that I enter the correct password.

Also, I already Google this problem. Some of the solutions offered was to change the Authentication Method to be OAuth2. When I check, by default, OAuth2 is selected as the Authentication Method.

How can I fix this?
creator: ikmal.workspace

title: non accedo più alla posta Gmail

title: Connection times out
content: This has been happening for a few days now. When I try to download emails I get "connection to imap/virginmedia timed out" I get occasional emails coming through but not as many as I would normally expect. I've done the usual re-booting etc. Ive even deleted Thunderbird altogether (saved the profile file) and reinstalled. It first started with a message from Virgin saying that emails would be unavailable for a few hours overnight so I put it doen to that. After speaking to Virgin they assure me that there is no problem in my area now. Any ideas / suggestions. Thanks

title: Microsoft Outlook Password
content:
Hello,

I am using the latest stable release of Thunderbird client on Windows 11 and just today it's been asking me multiple times for a password to my Outlook account. I have kept adding a one time app password through the official Microsoft website under account management but it's been asking a few times that it needs a password.

Do you know if there's been any outages to the Microsoft servers or what this issue could be related to? Is there a way I can send any logs directly to you that might help find the issue?

Thank you for your time.

title: Retaining emails
content:
I use Thunderbird on my home and office computer. (I do donate and appreciate the hard work of the staff.) At my office, I've had TB on for over a decade after I moved from another email client. I can keep emails that are literally, 10 years old. But, at home, my emails are automatically deleted after about 30, sometimes less if I get a lot of emails. I've played with every setting in TB and with no success. I really need my emails to stay on TB for at least a year. Am I doing something wrong, or is it a email server issue. I have Charter (Spectrum) on all my computers.

Thanks, Dave
creator: dwilson49

title: Unable to add account to Thunderbird Mail Client - Desktop - Windows 11
content:
Hello

I'm having an issue adding a new email account to Thunderbird.

I have checked all server settings, and they match the settings provided by the email provider.

It keeps coming up with an error stating that the password is incorrect. However, this is not correct, as I've confirmed that this is the correct password for this account through their web app.

I have attached a screenshot of the server settings I have inputted. The password has been checked to ensure it is correct by unhiding the asterisks.

Here is the link for the settings provided to me by the email provider:

https://www.virginmedia.com/help/broadband/manage-email-account

Could you please let me know how to alleviate this issue and add the account to my email client.

Kind Regards, Frank Chamberlain
creator: tmhltd

title: Reply Email Header Missing
content:
Is there a way or will this it be added for header information be added when replying to emails? That information is needed on replies. It is only avaialble if you do a forward of a message so why not during a reply. The reply with header should be similar to Outlook or Gmail it seems to be a standard across many email clients.

Example:


Best Regards, Dedicated User

______________________________________________________ Subject: Possible feature request Date: Mon, 3 Jul 2023 02:39:23 +0000 From: Just Asking question <example@gmail.com> To: destination@somewhere.com

title: Help! Moving Thunderbird data to new computer failed!
content:
Migrating my Thunderbird emails from my source computer to a destination computer failed. Both are Windows machines. Here's what I did: 1. I backed up my TB profile on my source computer. I did not copy the entire TB folder; I only copied the profile folder named a1kie4bp.default. 2. On my destination computer, I installed TB version 102.12.0. I launched the TB application and then closed it. This created the profile folder AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\2uvjpn58.default on my destination computer. (It also created \q971efhp.default-release there too.) 3. I then copied the contents of my backed up profile folder a1kie4bp.default into the new profile folder 2uvjpn58.default. But when I launched TB, it did not see my email data and went straight to the new account wizard.

BTW, the contents of AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\profiles.ini file is:

[InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/q971efhp.default-release Locked=1

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/2uvjpn58.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/q971efhp.default-release

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

What am I doing wrong? How can I restore my emails in the destination computer? Your help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you, Maz
creator: mazyarm
